DOC.brief_summary: Circulating tumor DNA detection and quantification in patients with metastatic choroidal melanoma.
DOC.brief_title: Study of Circulating Tumoral DNA in Metastatic Choroidal Melanoma
DOC.detailed_description: Technique development: In first step, the different available techniques will be evaluated for specificity and sensibility using serial dilutions of cell lines with or without GNAQ mutation. Validation: The tumor DNA detection rate will be estimated from metastatic uveal patient's blood. The investigators will study 40 patients to obtain at least 15 patients bearing a GNAQ mutation in the primitive tumor or in metastasis. With those 15 patients, the investigators will determinate the most sensitive technique and the best cost/efficiency ratio.
DOC.criteria: Age > or = 18 years. Patient with a metastatic choroidal melanoma. Patient with tumor or metastasis available for GNAQ (Guanine nucleotide blinding protein) status characterization. Patient able to stand a blood collection. Signed written informed consent approved by competent authority and ethic committee. Patient without social protection/insurance. Current pregnancy and lactation. All social, medical, psychological, situations making the study impossible. Person deprived of liberty.
